issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
from IRC discussion with skvidal and david k:

skvidal 
also when I restart eucalyptus-console
I get
Starting eucalyptus-console: /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto/pyami/config.py:75: UserWarning: Unable to load AWS_CREDENTIAL_FILE (/root/euca-admin/iamrc)
1:38
  warnings.warn('Unable to load AWS_CREDENTIAL_FILE (%s)' % full_path)

dak419
eh..
probably benign
I think it is boto trying to do something and we don't care about that.

1:39
skvidal
I do not love that expression, I'll be honest with you

1:39
dak419
I didn't realize we spit that out
skivdal, did you get that 2.5.2-1 boto and try it out?

1:40
jmolo
dak419:  is it possible to swallow that message and not display it?
1:41
bteachenor left the room.

1:41
dak419
I'll have to see it first. I could kick into the debugger when boto is doing that to examine the call stack
1:41
then, I could find out what causes that and determine a fix from there.
fields.summary: boto error displays in console log

comments.body: I need to figure out why this code (in boto) is being called. assign to me
trying to unset it. We don't care about it, so might as well un-set it to remove potential for the warning.
when trying to reproduce this, so I could verify the fix, I could not get the error to show up. Shelving this for now.
I'll remove this from the sprint and 3.3.1.
[~dkavanagh] seeing this on a 3.3.0 and 3.3.0.1 cloud.  Any info you need?

This is a harmless error and a side effect of some boto code trying to find the eucarc file. If this is important, perhaps I should patch and submit a pull request? Unlikely that would justify having a customer upgrade boto. I'd recommend simply setting the AWS_CREDENTIAL_FILE properly, or not define it at all.
Ok, noted.  Might be nice to have it tidied up within boto?

I'm trying to remember if I ever figured out what called the code path that this is in. I think I looked at un-setting the environment variable, but that wasn't something I could do in python (from what I remember).

Verifyed by stopping eucalyptus-console then 

export AWS_CREDENTIAL_FILE=blargh

then starting eucalyptus-console.  Saw no error message.
